result.execSummary:
The defendant Darius Dywone Berry was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Provide DNA sample; pay the DNA surcharge during extended supervision time on 22CF1932; failure to pay shall result in a civil judgment being entered. Pay all mandatory court costs, fees and surcharges during extended supervision time on 22CF1932; failure to pay shall result in a civil judgment being entered. Court waived all non-mandatory court costs, fees and surcharges finding the defendant indigent.
Defendant is advised he/she may not possess any firearms.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Darius Dywone Berry

records.addlTxt:
AS TO COUNT 2:
Defendant changes plea to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to defendant's plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty. Court found that defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived their rights. Plea questionnaire received and filed. Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the information and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record. Defendant is advised he/she and may not possess any firearms. 

AS TO COUNTS 1 and 3: Per plea negotiations and on the State's motion, Court ordered dismissed and read in.

Sentencing proceeds.  Statements made by the State, defense counsel and defendant. 
.
Defendant sentenced to serve 4 months at the HOUSE OF CORRECTION, consecutive to 21CM3103, 22CF1932, 22CM1431.
.
COURT ORDERS:
-Defendant is to provide DNA sample and pay DNA surcharge during the extended supervision time on 22CF1932; failure to pay shall result in a civil judgment being entered;
-Defendant is to pay all mandatory court costs, fees and surcharges during the extended supervision time on 22CF1932; failure to pay shall result in a civil judgment being entered;
-Court waived all non-mandatory court costs, fees and surcharges finding the defendant indigent. 

.
Appeal rights given. Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief received and filed. Copy given to defendant. -- gmb

Defendant Darius Dywone Berry in court, in custody.  Prosecuting attorney Michelle A. Grasso in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Havas, Branch 10.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.

Defendant Darius Dywone Berry not in court, in custody.  Attorney John Mathew Krejci appeared by video for Darius Dywone Berry.  Prosecuting attorney Michelle A. Grasso in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Attorney Krejci appears by video unable to appear in person.  Case is adjourned to 10-27-22 at 8:30 for an Initial appearance..
Initial appearance scheduled for October 27, 2022 at 08:30 am.
